pages.text: Vagrants posess an internal storage of parasitic biomass that they can use to create parasites, or undergo certain functions.

This resource functions extremely similarly to the internal soul storage of other parasites, save for its lack of involvement in evolution. Vagrants of higher tiers appear to be able to store more of it, though. Biomass is also used by Vagrants to heal.

Much like said storage, biomass is generally gained whenever a Vagrant kills another living creature. They can also obtain it by dissolving parasites of or below their Tier, with a few exceptions.$(br)$(#630000)I can do this by pressing $(k:use) with a bound Factory, or while crouching with an empty mainhand.
A sketch Subject #5 produced when prompted about biomass.

Additionally, it takes the place of Hunger, so a Vagrant cannot starve to death under normal circumstances. Vagrants can convert food straight to biomass via consuming it, a trait shared with placed Factories.$(br)The food must be dropped onto the Factory, rather than directly given to it, though.
